verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> Jehovah <WH3068>, and said <WH559>,
I know <WH3045> that thou canst do <WH3201> all things <WH4209>, And that no purpose of thine can be restrained <WH1219>.

Who is this that hideth <WH5956> counsel <WH6098> without knowledge <WH1847>? Therefore have I uttered <WH5046> that which I understood <WH995> not <WH6381>, Things too wonderful for me <WH3045>, which I knew not.
Hear <WH8085>, I beseech thee <WH1696>, and I will speak; I will demand <WH7592> of thee <WH3045>, and declare thou unto me.
I had heard <WH8085> of thee by the hearing <WH8088> of the ear <WH241>; But now mine eye <WH5869> seeth thee <WH7200>:
Wherefore I abhor <WH3988> myself <WH5162>, And repent in dust <WH6083> and ashes <WH665>.

And it was so <WH310>, that, after Jehovah <WH3068> had spoken <WH1696> these words <WH1697> unto Job <WH347>, Jehovah <WH3068> said <WH559> to Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489>, My wrath <WH639> is kindled <WH2734> against thee <WH8147>, and against thy two friends <WH7453>; for ye have not spoken <WH1696> of me the thing that is right <WH3559>, as my servant <WH5650> Job hath <WH347>.

Now therefore <WH3947>, take unto you seven <WH7651> bullocks <WH6499> and seven <WH7651> rams <WH352>, and go <WH3212> to my servant <WH5650> Job <WH347>, and offer up <WH5927> for yourselves a burnt-offering <WH5930>; and my servant <WH5650> Job <WH347> shall pray <WH6419> for you <WH6440>; for him will I accept <WH5375>, that I deal <WH6213> not with you after your folly <WH5039>; for ye have not spoken <WH1696> of me the thing that is right <WH3559>, as my servant <WH5650> Job hath <WH347>.

So Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489> and Bildad <WH1085> the Shuhite <WH7747> and Zophar <WH6691> the Naamathite <WH5284> went <WH3212>, and did <WH6213> according as Jehovah <WH3068> commanded <WH1696> them <WH3068>: and Jehovah accepted <WH5375> Job <WH6440>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> turned <WH7725> the captivity <WH7622> of Job <WH347>, when he prayed <WH6419> for his friends <WH7453>: and Jehovah <WH3068> gave <WH3254> Job <WH347> twice as much as he had before <WH4932>.

Then came <WH935> there unto him all his brethren <WH251>, and all his sisters <WH269>, and all they that had been of his acquaintance <WH3045> before <WH6440>, and did eat <WH398> bread <WH3899> with him in his house <WH1004>: and they bemoaned <WH5110> him <WH5162>, and comforted him concerning all the evil <WH7451> that Jehovah <WH3068> had brought <WH935> upon him <WH376>: every man also gave <WH5414> him a <WH259> piece of money <WH7192>, and every one <WH376> a <WH259> ring of gold <WH2091>.

So Jehovah <WH3068> blessed <WH1288> the latter end <WH319> of Job <WH347> more than his beginning <WH7225>: And he had fourteen <WH702> thousand <WH505> sheep <WH6629>, and six <WH8337> thousand <WH505> camels <WH1581>, and a thousand <WH505> yoke <WH6776> of oxen <WH1241>, and a thousand <WH505> she-asses <WH860>.
He had also seven <WH7658> sons <WH1121> and three <WH7969> daughters <WH1323>.

And he called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of the first <WH259>, Jemimah <WH3224>: and the name <WH8034> of the second <WH8145>, Keziah <WH7103>; and the name <WH8034> of the third <WH7992>, Keren-happuch <WH7163>.

And in all the land <WH776> were no women <WH802> found <WH4672> so fair <WH3303> as the daughters <WH1323> of Job <WH347>: and their father <WH1> gave <WH5414> them inheritance <WH5159> among <WH8432> their brethren <WH251>.

And after <WH310> this Job <WH347> lived <WH2421> a hundred <WH3967> and forty <WH705> years <WH8141>, and saw <WH7200> his sons <WH1121>, and his sons <WH1121>' sons <WH1121>, even four <WH702> generations <WH1755>.
So Job <WH347> died <WH4191>, being old <WH2205> and full <WH7649> of days <WH3117>.
